intro: Potamogeton teganumensis, commonly known as the Teganum watermilfoil, is a submerged aquatic plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as lakes, ponds, and slow-moving rivers. The plant has slender, branching stems with small, whorled leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants. Potamogeton teganumensis plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
